page.title: 18Tourism
page.content: Being an {Area of Outstanding {Natural Beauty}visitors are attracted to the Hills.There is a build up of cars parked every fine {Sunday {afternoon }especially around tea-time. Most of these visitors come from within a{20 mile radius}and only stay between{2 and 4 hours.Holford}and { {Hodders Combe}are very popular with {family}groups.People come for varius reasons e.g. a day out, peace and quiet, a picnic, to see the scenery, to go walking. All this puts great{pressure}on the {narrow lanes}leading to the most popular places.{Damage}is caused by {cars}leaving the roads. Some {tracks suffer by being too popular with { {walking parties1 Vegetation}takes years to grow again after this wear and tear.
